page.title: 01General Review Of Block 1985
page.content: S.E.OXON AND E.N.E.BERKS 76,80. The Block contains E.S.E. Henley and District divided by the River Thames which flows NW from Reading & Wargrave & then NE to Marlow & Maidenhead.It has made a wide valley through the chalk of the Chiltern Hills.On the west bank is Henley town & the village of Harpsden, (Oxon).On the east bank are the villages of Remenham,Cockpole Green & Crazies Hill & nine farms.This land is covered with woods & fields of grass for grazing & hay,cereals & market gardening,(Berks).One twelfth of the Area is approximately urban.From Henley the A423 runs east to Hurley 3km.The A231 runs SE from Henley on the east bank to Wargrave 1km.From Henley the A4155 runs SE to Shiplake 1km.The train service links Henley to Paddington via Twyford.This is a popular tourist area.
